node.title: Christina loves living in WA's 'COVID-free bubble'. More than nine in 10 people there agree
node.alt: Two women push their luggage while arriving at Sydney airport
node.description: An overwhelming majority of survey respondents in Western Australia and South Australia say their governments have done a good job of managing COVID-19.
node.content:
["Early in the pandemic, Christina Odorus flew into Perth from Jakarta with her husband and daughter for a brief holiday to visit relatives. Almost two years on, they are still in Western Australia.", "\"I'm really happy with how the WA government has handled the pandemic,\" said Ms Odorus, whose Australian-Indonesian family decided to permanently relocate due to the pandemic.", "While there were pros and cons of the strictness of the government's policy compared with other states, she said, \"we are really, really living in a COVID-free bubble and living a normal life\".", "It's a view that resonates with more than nine in 10 people in WA questioned\u00a0for the national Mapping Social Cohesion Survey.", "", "
Ms Odorus says she is \"really happy\" with how WA has responded to COVID.(Supplied)
", "Run since 2007, the annual survey\u00a0tracks\u00a0attitudes to a range of issues, including trust in other community members\u00a0and government in Australia, as well as perceptions of racism, immigration, Indigenous Australians and multiculturalism.", "Questions about COVID-19 showed an overwhelming 94 per cent of respondents in WA had a positive view of the state's management of the pandemic.", "Ms Odorus said despite the difficulty of being separated from family,\u00a0her mother in Indonesia was happy that the WA government had made decisions \"to protect the people\", and that her four-year-old could \"enjoy a normal life\" and attend school in person.", "In South Australia, meanwhile, 88 per cent of respondents\u00a0felt their\u00a0state government had done \"very well\" or \"fairly well\" in managing COVID.", "Anna Cheung is president of the Tong De Association in SA, a Chinese community group in Adelaide that has provided aid to people in need throughout the pandemic.", "", "
Ms Cheung says the high rate of vaccination in Australia is cause for optimism.(Supplied)
", "\"The state government has done an amazing job to control COVID,\" she told the ABC.", "\"Very responsive action\" had meant there were very low cases,\u00a0Ms Cheung said, adding she felt this is why Adelaide had been named one of the world's most liveable cities.", "
'Australia's strong social cohesion is a national asset'
", "By contrast, 52 per cent of respondents said the federal government had responded to the pandemic well, down from 85 per cent in both July and November 2020.", "The Queensland government saw a drop in those who\u00a0had a positive assessment of the COVID response, from 92 per cent in July 2020 to 76 per cent; while in NSW, 59 per cent of people approved of the state's response compared with 81 per cent last year.", "Some 71 per cent of Victorians approved of the state government's response.", "\"During the first eight months of the COVID-19 crisis, Australia had experienced increased social cohesion\u00a0as people responded to a common threat through mutual support,\" said Anthea Hancocks, head of the Scanlon Foundation, which funds the survey.", "This trend largely continued into 2021, according to the survey findings.", "More people (71 per cent) felt optimistic about Australia's future in 2021 than last year, while those believing \"most people can be trusted\" had increased significantly from 2020.", "\"With the vaccination rollout, we'll probably even get tablets in the future\u00a0\u2026 people feel more secure, more safe,\" Ms Cheung said.", "Andrew Markus, the study's author, said the high rate of COVID vaccine take-up in Australia compared with other countries in Europe and North America in itself demonstrated Australia's high level of social cohesion.", "\"Australia's strong social cohesion is a national asset and in no small part the reason we are the world's leading multicultural society,\" said Immigration Minister Alex Hawke in a statement.", "\"Despite the tough year many Australians have experienced, we have stayed together, with the value and trust we place in our neighbours and local communities increasing.\"", "", "
Multicultural leaders in Sydney's west encouraging COVID vaccination
", "
Awareness of racism in Australia on the rise
", "In the 2021 survey, 60 per cent of respondents said racism was a problem in Australia.", "This was a marked increase from when 40 per cent of respondents said it was a \"fairly\" or \"very\" big problem in Australia during the pandemic in 2020.", "\"This strong increase in community awareness [of racism] is crucially important to stamping it out,\" Mr Hawke said.", "\"Attitudes toward specific multicultural communities became more positive across the board, with no increase in racist or xenophobic views amongst respondents,\" he added.", "", "
Professor Markus says the findings indicate a remarkably high level of social cohesion in Australia.(Supplied: Monash University)
", "Mary Patetsos, head of the Federation of Ethnic Communities' Councils of Australia, said the survey data highlighted\u00a0both the strengths and weaknesses of Australian multiculturalism, including \"the urgent need for a well-funded national anti-racism strategy\".", "\"Persistent incidents of racial abuse, as well as systemic racism, are a threat to our multicultural success story,\" she said.", "In 2021, 76 per cent of respondents agreed that \"accepting immigrants from many different countries makes Australia stronger\", a steady increase from previous years.", "And 86 per cent of people agreed that \"multiculturalism has been good for Australia\".", "\"The recognition that racism is a serious problem in this country, again, was not expected,\" Professor Markus said.", "\"You've got prime ministers going around saying 'we're the most successful multicultural country in the world', and I think that probably gets\u00a0dismissed as spin.", "\"But there seems there's actually a lot of substance behind it,\" he said."]
